ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English entirelye, derived from entire (complete, whole) + -ly (adverb suffix). 'Entire' ultimately comes from Latin integrum.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adverb (modifies verbs, adjectives, or other adverbs)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To the full extent or degree; completely, absolutely, or wholly.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 完全地；彻底地；全然地；丝毫不留地。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The success of the project depends entirely on our team effort.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 项目的成功完全取决于我们团队的努力。
